main.h1: Start Accepting Online Payment On Your App or Website
main.p: Safqa Payment Collection Company is a Financial Technology company that provides a full suite of payment solutions that meets the needs of its customers.

about.p1: Safqa's objective is to provide customer the latest technology of collecting payments as a solution combined with consistency and accuracy without compromising the applicable regulatory guidelines.
about.p2: In this regard, Safqa is committed to the highest standards of Business Continuity Management (BCM). The company’s BCM strategies, goals and objectives are examined on an ongoing basis and an effective BCM program to maintain our business in accordance with best practices in the industry.

ourservices.title: Our services
ourservices.p_1: Receive payments via Safqa And Send your Invoice via WhatsApp, Email and SMS
ourservices.p_1_2: And Send Invoice via WhatsApp, Email and SMS.
ourservices.p_2: Safqa gives your business an easy access to POS avoiding cash handling costs and risks.
ourservices.p_3: Get integrated with Safqa’s payment gateway and start selling Online.
ourservices.p_4: You can easily send the payment link on any of the social networking sites.
ourservices.p_5: Start and boost your online commerce with Safqa.

ourapp.title: APP
ourapp.p: The app is available on the Apple Store and Google Play with an interesting new interface and improved features.

AboutFirstSection.title: About SAFQA
AboutFirstSection.p: Although managing our money is a necessary task, it is not always enjoyable or something at which we excel. Whether we are business owners or everyday customers, we must content with the daunting task of handling our finances on a daily basis, without exception. Perhaps you, you like many others, have found yourself pondering the same questions. Is technology not meant to ease our burdens? Shouldn’t we be able to live a fulfilling life free of excessive stress?

AboutSecondSection.title: What do we do?
AboutSecondSection.p: Our company is specialized in providing payment processing and a wide range of payment services tailored to meet the needs of merchants, retailers, governments, banks and other businesses. Our offerings cover  all aspects of payment processing, from competitive pricing to round-the-clock (24h/7) customer support, ensuring that our clients receive a seamless and fully customized experience. With the latest payment processing equipment at their disposal, businesses can trust us to provide them with innovative solutions that meet their unique needs.

AboutThirdSection.title: SAFQA Company
AboutThirdSection.p: Safqa is a company specialized in providing cutting-edge electronic payment services and modern financial and banking information technology. Our commitment to delivering top-quality equipment, pricing and solutions sets us apart from our competitors, and we take pride in offering our customers the very best and fastest service available. With turnaround times of less than 24 hours from order to receipt, we prioritize speed and efficiency in all aspects of operations and transactions.

AboutFourthSection.title: Mission and vision
AboutFourthSection.p: Safqa’s mission is to be the preferred companion for all clients seeking innovative technology and a smart, mobile-empowered digital economy. To achieve this goal, we are committed to three core principles:

items.security: Security: Safqa the importance of maintaining the highest standards of security in all our operations. To this end, we utilize the newest and most innovative technologies in IT security and continually enhance our fraud and anti-money laundering procedures. Our aim is to minimize fraud and operational risks, providing our clients with safe and sound platform for all their transactions.
items.innovation: Innovation: we prioritize the adoption and introduction of the latest technological innovations allowing us to offer cutting-edge services that meet the evolving of our clients.
items.convenience: Convenience: aware by the fact that the client expects a convenient and hassle-free experience when using our services, we focus on offering you an improved customer experience and creating user-friendly interfaces. By prioritizing convenience, we strive to make our services accessible to everyone and to facilitate greater ease of use for all kinds of our clients.

AboutFifthSection.title: Our Principles and Commitments
AboutFifthSection.p: To ensure the safety of financial transactions and the privacy of our users, our website operates according to principles that guide our electronic activity. Therefore, we are committed to:

items.transparency: Transparency: We strive to clearly display information, costs, and usage fees.
items.speed_and_efficiency: Speed and efficiency: Safqa’s website enables electronic payment transactions to be conducted quickly and efficiently, making it easier for users to make online payments and earn time and effort that would be required to process a traditional transaction.
items.security: Our website attaches great importance to the principle of security, which involves securing all financial transactions that are processed on it. Without security, we cannot gain the trust of our customers, so one of our priorities is to provide a safe and encrypted environment for conducting financial transactions using the latest technologies to protect user data and avoid all kinds of fraudulent activities.
items.privacy: Privacy: We care about preserving the privacy of our users' data and not sharing it with any other party. We also adhere to the principles of personal data protection and compliance with the laws and regulations related to it.
items.accessible: Accessible and user-friendly website for everyone: We are committed to always facilitating access to Safqa’s website. Therefore, if you encounter difficulty in viewing or browsing our website and accessing its content or find that using one of its functions is difficult or not fully accessible for people with special needs, please contact us and provide an accurate description of the concerned function. You can also send us your improvement suggestions because your opinion matters, and we will take it into consideration to evaluate measures seeking to satisfy all our customers.
items.reliability: Reliability: At our website, we aim first and foremost to build a sustainable and profitable business relationship for both parties, in which respect and trust are the foundation. Therefore, we are extremely committed to fulfilling our obligations to our esteemed customers, providing high-quality services, and delivering them on time. We also strive to conduct all transactions with honesty and integrity, protect the confidentiality of customer information and data, and respond to their inquiries and concerns in a timely and professional manner.

services.title: Start receiving your electronic payments
services.p: Safqa offers the most convenient and user-friendly payment methods to its customers. Additionally, it seamless integration of all electronic payment systems with a variety of available electronic platforms. This ensures that our customer enjoy a hassle-free payment experience, with a wide range of payment options and platforms to choose from. This ensures that our customers enjoy a hassle-free payment experience, with a wide range of payment options and platforms to choose from. Our commitment to providing a smooth and efficient payment process sets apart from out competitors, and we are constantly working to improve our services to better meet needs of our clients.

ServiceCard1.body: Safqa Billing provides a complete billing solution that is suitable for businesses of any size and type. Whether a small and medium-sized company, or even an online business of any kind, Safqa Billing is your right choice. Our billing is designed to meet needs of all kinds of businesses, offering a range customizable features to ensure that you get the most out of our services. With our easy-to-use platform and user-friendly interface, managing your billing processes has never been easier. Choose Safqa Billing for a complete and reliable billing solution for your business.

body: Safqa’s POS puts at your fingertips a range of easy and convenient payment methods through our smart payment device. With our system, your customers can pay using all major credit cards or various e-wallets, as well as to pay in installments providing greater flexibility and making it easier to make purchases.

At our company, we understand the importance of providing a safe and fast payment experience for your clients. That’s why our payment system is designed with the latest security, ensuring that all transactions are well-processed, secure and protected. Additionally, Safqa’s system is optimized for speed and ease of use, allowing the customer to complete transactions quickly and easily.

By offering a variety of payment options and ensuring a safe and quick payment process, our POS system helps you to provide the best possible user experience. This can lead to increase Customer loyalty, higher Customer satisfaction rates, and ultimately, increased sales and revenue for your business.

Safqa’s payment Gateway offers fast and seamless integration to optimize all your financial transactions. We make it easy for your company to integrate with a wide range of tools and APIs to help your business grow and evolve. With just one step, you can integrate our payment Gateway solution and let Safqa lead your company forward towards sustainable growth.

We are completely conscious that in today’s fast-paced business environment, time is of the essence. That’s why our payment Gateway is based on speed and efficiency, ensuring that all your transactions are protected from fraud and fast. That’s to say that integrating with our payment Gateway solution, your company can streamline financial transactions, reduce processing times, and improve overall efficiency. This can help your business to stay ahead of the competition and achieve sustained growth. With Safqa you can trust that your financial transactions are in professional and good hands.

Safqa’s payment links help you to boost your sales and generate more profits by sending a payment ling to your customers. This ensures a successful and easy transaction process, with quick payment processing. If you do not have your own website, you can still receive electronic payments from your customers through Safqa payment link.

Sending the payment link is simple and ca, be done through any social media platform, allowing the customers to pay for their purchases in the fastest way possible. Ergo, this eliminates the possibility of errors or fraud during the payment process.

Safqa’s payment links help you to boost your sales and generate more profits by sending a payment ling to your customers. This ensures a successful and easy transaction process, with quick payment processing. If you do not have your own website, you can still receive electronic payments from your customers through Safqa payment link.

Sending the payment link is simple and ca, be done through any social media platform, allowing the customers to pay for their purchases in the fastest way possible. Ergo, this eliminates the possibility of errors or fraud during the payment process.

With Safqa you can create and launch your own E-commerce Website Instantly! We offer you powerful tools that will help you connect with potential clients., drive sales, and streamline your daily business operations.
Effortlessly, set up you online store and seamlessly synchronize your products across your website, marketplaces, social media platforms, and live in-person sales channels.
Our integrated Payment Gateway plugins ensure that you can securely accept credit card payments from customers anywhere in the world, without any hassle.

policy.title: Introduction
items: We care committed to protecting the privacy of visitors to SAFQA site. This policy outlines how we collect and manage your personal information.
By agreeing to our use of cookies according to this policy when you visit the Site for the first time, you consent us to use cookies each time you visit the Site.

policy.title: Collection of personal information on the SAFQA site
items: The following personal information may be collected, stored and used: Information about your computer including your Internet Protocol address, geographic location, browser type and  version, and operating system.
Information about your visits to and use of this website including the referral source, duration of visit, what you view on the page, and your browsing paths on the website.
Information that you enter when registering on the SAFQA site, such as your email address.
Information that you enter when creating a profile on a SAFQA site – for example, your name, profile pictures, gender, date of birth.
Information, such as your name and email address, that you enter in order to set up subscriptions to our emails and/or newsletters.
Information that you enter while using the services of the SAFQA site.
Information that is generated while using the Site, including the dates and frequency of your use of the Site and the circumstances in which you use the Site.
Information about anything you buy, the services you use, or the transactions you make through the site, which includes your name, address, phone number, email address and credit card details.
Information that you post on the SAFQA website for the purpose of sharing it online, which includes your username, profile pictures, and the content of your posts.
Information contained in any communications you send to us via e-mail or via the SAFQA website, including shared content and metadata.

Any other personal information you submit to us. Before you disclose to us the personal information of another person, you must obtain that person's consent to both the disclosure and the processing of such personal information in accordance with this Policy.

policy.title: Use of your personal information
items: The personal information submitted to us through the SAFQA site is used for the purposes described in this policy or on the relevant pages of the site. We may use your personal information for the following purposes:
Managing the SAFQA site and our business on the Internet.
Customize your SAFQA website to be the most convenient for you.
Enable you to use the services available on the SAFQA website.
The goods you buy online are sent to you.
Providing services purchased through a SAFQA website on the Internet.
Sending statements, invoices and payment notifications to you, and collecting payments from you.
Send you commercial, non-marketing messages.
To send you email notifications that you have specifically requested to be sent to you.
To send you our email newsletter, if you have requested it (you can inform us at any time if you no longer need the newsletter).

Sending you marketing communications relating to our business or the businesses of carefully selected third parties which we think may be of interest to you, by post or, if you have specifically agreed, by email or similar technology (you may inform us at any time if you do not You no longer need these marketing communications).
Providing third parties with statistical information about our users (however, these third parties will not be able to identify users of that information themselves).
SAFQAing with inquiries and complaints made by you or submitted to us about you on the SAFQA website.
Protect the SAFQA's website from fraud and maintain its security.
Verify compliance with the terms and conditions governing the use of the SAFQA site (including monitoring private messages sent through the signatory message service).
Other uses.
If you submit personal information for publication on the SAFQA site, we will publish and otherwise use that information in accordance with the license you grant to us.
Your privacy settings may be used to limit the publication of your information on the Site and may be modified using the Site's privacy controls.
We will not provide any third party, without your express consent, your personal information for the purposes of direct marketing to any other party.

policy.title: Disclosure of personal information
items: We may disclose your personal information to any of our employees, officers, insurance companies, professional advisors, agents, suppliers or subcontractors as reasonably necessary for the purposes set out in this Policy.

We may disclose your personal information to any member of our group of companies (that is, our subsidiaries, the parent holding company and all of its subsidiaries) to the extent reasonably necessary for the purposes set out in this Policy.
We may disclose your personal information:
As much as we are required to do by law.
In connection with any ongoing or potential legal proceedings.
In order to establish, exercise or defend our legal rights (including providing information to others for the purposes of fraud prevention and credit risk reduction).
To the purchaser (or potential purchaser) of any business or asset that we are (or intend to) sell.

Any person we reasonably believe may apply to a court or other competent authority for disclosure of that personal information, in our reasonable discretion, and such court or authority would reasonably be able to order disclosure of that personal information.
Except as provided in this policy, we will not provide your personal information to third parties.

policy.title: International data transfer
items: Information we collect may be stored, processed or transferred between any of the countries in which we operate to enable us to use the information in accordance with this Policy.

The information we collect may be transferred to the following countries that are not subject to data protection laws equivalent to those in the European Economic Area: the United States of America, Russia, Japan, China and India.
We cannot prevent others from using or misusing the personal information that you publish on the SAFQA site or send for publication on the SAFQA site, which is available online around the world.
You expressly consent to the transfers of personal information described in this Section E.

policy.title: Retention of personal information
items: This Section F sets out our data retention policies and procedures, which are designed to help ensure that we comply with our legal obligations regarding the retention and deletion of personal information.
Personal information that we process for any purpose or purposes shall not be retained for longer than is necessary for that purpose or those purposes.
Notwithstanding the other provisions of this Section, we retain documents (including electronic documents) that contain personal data:
To the extent required by law.
If we believe that these documents may be relevant to any ongoing or potential legal proceedings.
In order to initiate, exercise or defend our legal rights (including providing information to others for the purposes of fraud prevention and credit risk reduction.

policy.title: Security of your personal information
items: We undertake to take reasonable technical and organizational precautions to prevent loss, misuse or alteration of your personal information.
We undertake to store all personal information you provide on our secure servers that are protected by a password and a firewall.
All electronic financial transactions made through the site of a SAFQA are protected by encryption technology.

You acknowledge that you agree to this Policy knowing that transmission of information over the Internet is inherently not secure, and we cannot guarantee the security of data transmitted over the Internet.
You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of the password you use to access the site. We will not ask you for your password (except when logging in to the SAFQA site).

policy.title: Adjustments
items: We may update this policy from time to time by posting a new version on the SAFQA website. You should review this page from time to time to ensure that you understand any changes to this policy, and we may notify you of changes to this policy by e-mail or through the private messaging system on the SAFQA website.

terms_and_conditions.title: Terms And Conditions
terms_and_conditions.description: The following Terms and Conditions below constitute a contract between the user of the Company's service (who can be a merchant, a seller, an organization, or an individual representing any of the above) and the trading company.

terms.title: General Terms
items: Only companies, institutions, individuals, and organizations whose officials and authorities are allowed to make and receive payments in their country can apply to use the Transaction Service. Persons who are not permitted to receive funds or conduct commercial or non-commercial financial operations in their country are not allowed to use the Transaction Services.
The transfer amount must be for the same purpose mentioned in the service request form and should align with the authorized activities of the merchant.
The business name shown on the invoice must represent the company and its authorized activities.
Merchants under the age of 18 must be a legal guardian, in accordance with the laws in force in the country.

The entity or individual applying for the service agrees that SAFQA may request additional information or update previously provided data at any time. Examples of information and data that may be requested include, but are not limited to, identification, business policies and procedures, financial information, licenses, invoices, delivery receipts, or any other information necessary for the provision of the service. Failure to provide the requested information may result in interruption of service or termination of the contract.

Agree to notify us of any modifications to your business, including a change in the nature of the activity, ownership, transaction volume, geographic location, and other activity changes that affect the assessment.

SAFQA grants its users a non-exclusive, non-negotiable, or transferable license to use its services. Users are not permitted to use SAFQA Services to transfer or receive money on behalf of other unapproved websites or intermediaries.

When you register with SAFQA, fill out application forms, and approve your account, you will be able to access SAFQA platform. From there, you can view your sales operations through the dashboard, request additional services, communicate with the support team, and submit a request to change the banking data registered in your account.

This contract is subject to the laws of the country/region where the transaction service is provided. Any disputes between the user and SAFQA site are subject to the jurisdiction of the court of the country/region.
Transactions may request additional or supplementary contracts with users.
SAFQA reserves the right to amend the terms and conditions at any time.

nestedBody.head: Prohibited activities include using SAFQA services to engage in any prohibited activity or to transact with bodies prohibited by SAFQA or the country of activity. That includes:
items: Find out who may be involved in criminal activity or be mentioned in the public list (blacklist) of criminal activity, drug trafficking and terrorist organizations.
Persons of an active nature whose legitimacy or source of income is difficult to verify, or sources of income that do not correspond to their financial situation.

Refuse to provide us with any information or documents necessary to verify their activities or sources of income, provide us with documents of authenticity or legality or tamper with suspect documents.
Institutions and companies whose shareholders or organizational structure cannot be determined.
Unauthorized exchange offices or other similar entities.
Financial institutions (shell banks) that do not have a physical presence in the country or region and are not affiliated with any regulated financial institution.
Activities violating the provisions of Islamic Shari.
Informal brokers.
Crypto currency companies such as bit coin/crypto currency trading accounts.
Activities that SAFQA directly or indirectly with countries subject to international sanctions, including (Iran, Syria, South Sudan, Cuba, Eritrea, Central African Republic, etc.).
Companies that do not provide any sufficient information to verify their identity or the identity of the ultimate beneficiary.

Traders or ultimate beneficiaries (clients) who have been sanctioned under the resolutions of the United Nations, the Treasury, the European Union or OFAC, or whose names match any other sanctions list.
Businessmen or final beneficiaries (clients) residing in countries subject to international sanctions, including (Iran, Syria, South Sudan, Cuba, Eritrea, Central African Republic, etc.).
Casinos, casinos, bookmakers, including online gambling companies.
Merchants who provide financial services without the approval of the Central Bank, such as (unauthorized private financial investments, commercial companies, fundraising or remittances, etc.).
Charities and non-profit organizations not approved by the Ministry of Social Affairs. Anonymous and registered accounts under fake names.
Numbered accounts whose owners are identified by numbers instead of names.
Merchants did not complete their due diligence procedures or were unable to investigate due to uncertainty or ambiguity about the information available to them.
Prohibited or restricted activities can be updated at any time

terms.title: User Responsibilities and Agreements:
items: The e-mail used by applicants for trading services is the official means of communicating with users. The applicant agrees to the use of email verification and agrees to the terms and conditions and all information relating to the user.
All fields of the registration form must be completed and all required documents attached before the application for registration is approved.
All information that the client sends to the SAFQA site through any type of written or oral media must be true and accurate.
All requested information must be submitted within 21 days of registration. Incomplete registration requests will be automatically canceled after the specified period.

Newly registered applicants can make up to 4 transactions before an account is approved for them, but the funds will not  be transferred to the applicant's bank account until the approval process is completed. Payments for rejected registration applications will not be transferred and will be refunded to the originator .Payment settlement and refund process

nestedBody.head: A transaction may withhold payments and request supporting documents and evidence to verify the legitimacy of payments before transferring them to the user's bank account. In the event that the customer fails to provide sufficient evidence to prove the legitimacy of the transferred amounts, it has the right to take all necessary measures in this case, which include refunding the amounts to their source, canceling the account and informing the concerned authorities without informing the user or obtaining any kind of approval. The information exchanged with the relevant financial institutions or official bodies may include information about the user that may include the user’s financial transactions or any other information as needed:
items: The user does not have the right to object to the seizure of any amounts related to payment transactions or that have been refunded to their source in the event that any evidence or documents that prove the legitimacy of payment operations are not satisfied.

Settlement of payments and deposits takes place within 24 business hours or the next business day if the user does not request a different time period for settlements and deposits. A transaction may withhold payments for an indefinite period if it finds or finds that payments may be suspicious or illegal.

Deposit is settled according to the bank data provided by the user when registering the trading account. The user can request to change the registered bank data through the account platform or the official mailbox registered on the SAFQA website.
The user can use the “refund” option to redeem all or part of the payment, so he must have enough balance in his account to use the “refund” option
Transactions may maintain reserve amounts calculated based on the trading volume of high-risk clients. This reserve is settled upon closing of the account when it is no longer in use.

Due to the inability of the user to provide correct banking data, the site may return the amount that has not been transferred to the user's bank account for more than 30 days, so his account is considered neglected, which leads to the suspension of the account. Transactions of pending amounts may not be booked or transferred to other parties at the sole discretion of the site.
Transfer fee “commission” can be deducted directly from the amount transferred to the user during the settlement process
The user is obligated to pay any fees due within five working days. Certification of signatures and electronic notifications

Agreeing to register an account on your electronic signature transaction site, and communicating with us through support options, whether through a transaction application or a trading platform, is an official notification from you and is equivalent to your personal signature.

You agree that the e-mail used to register the account on the SAFQA site is your authorized e-mail and that all electronic transmissions received from this e-mail address are equivalent to an official letter signed by you or your legal representative.
Agree to receive all transaction notifications on your registered email and phone number for communication and verification purposes, “Multi-Factor Authentication System”.

terms.title: Duration / termination of the contract
items: Terms and conditions are valid as long as the subscription is valid for the SAFQA site.
The term of the contract with the SAFQA site is one year from the date of receiving the verification message and will be automatically renewed unless it is terminated by the user or the SAFQA site.
Termination of the contract does not mean a waiver of the user's previous payment requirements.
If a trading account is opened but the information and documents required to complete the registration process are not provided within 21 days, the account will be closed automatically.

SAFQA may suspend or cancel accounts at any time, and a notification will be sent to your registered email with the reasons. Such reasons are subject to the sole discretion of the Company and may include, but are not limited to, increased operational risk, suspicious operations, prohibited and illegal activities by the User, or changes in the operation or ownership and management of the User.
Data is kept for 10 years from the date of service discontinuation

terms.title: External Payment Providers
items: Merchants who apply to use Apple Pay Services through a Transaction agree to confirm their acceptance of the Apple Pay Merchant Terms, as specified on Apple's website, and that Transaction is not responsible for Merchant's failure to comply with these Terms
Merchants confirm their responsibility to follow future modifications to the Apple Pay Merchant Terms.

terms.title: force majeure conditions
items: SAFQA will not be liable for any loss or delay due to fire, natural disaster, banking system failure, power outage, telecommunications problems, wars, strikes, riots, or terrorist attacks; or failure in the performance of subsidiary banks, or failure in the performance of merchants, or any accidents or transaction events that they have no ability to control.

phrases: "Safqa" is an innovative financial application that offers a diverse range of services for individuals an businesses alike. This flexible platform enables users to create secure and easy payment links, simplifying the process of collecting funds and conducting financial transactions. With this feature, individuals can send and receive payments effortlessly, opening up new opportunities to expand their businesses and achieve financial growth.

Furthermore, the application facilitates the creation of streamlined and intelligent invoices, making it easier for individuals and businesses to manage their financial accounts effectively. Utilizing the invoicing tools, users can generate customized invoices for clients and track outstanding payments. Additionally, product and service details can be included in the invoices, enhancing the recipient's experience and promoting transparency in business transactions.

Notably, "Safqa" stands out with its integrated store feature, allowing anyone or any business to showcase and sell their products. Sellers can upload images, provide descriptions for their products, set prices, and efficiently monitor order status and sales. This functionality empowers individuals and small enterprises to reach a broader audience of potential customers and achieve greater success in the digital business landscape.

With its versatility and comprehensive suite of services, "Safqa" serves as a robust and efficient financial companion, catering to the needs of individuals and businesses in the modern era of technology and e-commerce.

DocsV1Components.WarningText: If you encounter an error when attempting to distribute your app to App Store, such as:

Overview.body1: This page will help you get started with Safqa API. You'll be up and running in no time!
Overview.body2: In today’s competitive world of global commerce, having an integrated payment solution can make all the difference to the success of your business.
Overview.body3: This document provides you all the necessary help you require to set up and integrate Safqa with your website. It will guide you through the step-by-step process of installing the required aforementioned plugins, configuring merchant details, and sending payment requests.
Overview.body4: We support the following plugins for API version 1:
Overview.body5: We provide documentation for the following languages: - VB.NET - PHP - Python - Ruby on Rails You will also find all the sample code you need, for these languages.
Overview.body6: In addition to our standard API, we offer a custom API that includes a simulated test environment. Once you have tested your integration and are satisfied with the results, you can go live with confidence.

Purpose.body1: This document is created to define and agree upon IT requirements for the integration of Safqa Plugin with Customers' website.
Purpose.body2: It outlines the IT understanding of requirements and aims to document the system automation that will be achieved.

Requirement.body1: Payment Processing: To process payments for the customer when they proceed to checkout. This will involve different types of transactions:

Test_cards.body2: Please find below the Test Card details for the various payment options we offer.
Test_cards.body3: After Safqa’s plugin has been integrated, you can use these details to perform test transactions and ensure that everything is working perfectly before going Live.
Test_cards.note: For VISA test card with card number '4508750015741019', the amount should be as per the scenarios given below:'Payment Gateway': 'Payment Gateway'

Benefit_results.7: Response code 05 Please contact the issuer

Test_cards.SADAD_result: Sadad Gateway accepts different types of payment methods such as Visa/Master cards.
Test_cards.No_reply: No reply from the Processing Host

Demo_Information.body1: In this section, we provide you with access information that can be used withing your development / testing environment. This information will be helpful to proceed your integration the soonest and get sure that your application is communicating properly and effectively with Safqa’s API. All what you need to proceed with in this testing and development are the URL and the API Key. The following information can be used to obtain these details:

Live_Information.body1: For Live credentials, you need to create a new API Accountusing the below steps:

items.2: Use your Super Master email and password to sign in.
items.3: Navigate to Manage Users on the side panel menu then select Create User.
items.4: Fill in user details. Don't use the Super Master email.
items.5: Select API in the Roles section.
items.7: You will receive a 'Change Password' email to the registered email.
items.8: Set the new password by clicking on the 'Change Password Now' button.
items.9: Make sure that you are able to login into the Safqa Portal Site with API credentials before completing the configuration process.
items.10: Use this API account (email and password) in the admin panel to complete the configuration.

Live_Information.body2: Once you get your API user username and password, use them into your live environment side together with the live gateway URL as shown in the table below:'Country_Portal': 'Country Portal'

Shipping_Information.body1: Kindly, follow below instruction to configure needed information that will be used by DHL or ARAMEX

items.3: Navigate to Home - Profile - Update Profile

Purpose.body: This document is created to define and agree the IT requirements for the integration of Safqa Plugin with Customers Website. This document outlines the IT understanding of requirements and aims to document the system automation that will be achieved.

Requirement.body: Payment Processing: to process payments for the customers when they proceed to checkout. This will involve different transaction kinds:

Dependencies.body: The communication between plugin and the customer website should be over internet.

Assumptions.body1: CUSTOMER will be notified of any failed & not canceled payments and directed to the merchant payment failure URL.
Assumptions.body2: CUSTOMER will be notified of successful payments and directed to the merchant payment success URL.

Scope.body: The scope of the functionality proposed in this document is restricted to payment-based integration only.

Rest_APIs.body1: You can create an invoice using the following API
Rest_APIs.Invoice_Value_title: Product Unit Price * Quantity of Products.
Rest_APIs.Invoice_Value_description: - Please note merchant should manually calculate and enter the subtotal.
Rest_APIs.Display_Currency_Iso_Alpha_title: Display Currency Iso Alpha Display Currency in Invoice.
Rest_APIs.Display_Currency_Iso_Alpha_description: Note: User should enter value of each Display Currency. (Each Display Currency differentiated by a Value). Invoice Value will be considering based on Display Currency Value and converting to KD.
Rest_APIs.Country_Code_Id_description: Please note user should enter value of each Country Code. (Each Country Codes differentiated by a Value).
Rest_APIs.Send_Invoice_Option_title: Send Invoice Options. (SMS, Email and Link)
Rest_APIs.Send_Invoice_Option_description: - Please note user should enter value of each Invoice option. Each sending options differentiated by a Value.
Rest_APIs.Product_Id_description: - Vendor can enter the Product Id, once it is created through Safqa system.
Rest_APIs.Language_description: - Please note user should enter value of each Language. Each Language (Arabic or English) options differentiated by a Value.
Rest_APIs.Expire_Date_title: Invoice Expiry Date Please note user should enter the future date and time as per the below format. Date: YYYY-MM-DD Time: HH:MM:SS
Rest_APIs.API_Custom_Fields_title: API Custom Fields. Field dedicated to integration with schools. Field to send some data related with school student.
Rest_APIs.API_Custom_Fields_description: Note: User can fill any value by comma separated values Example: 'ApiCustomFileds' : 'StudentAge=15, StudentGrade=100, StudentFileNumber=10'.
Rest_APIs.Error_URL_title: Error URL (Required) 'Should be Valid URL format'.
Rest_APIs.Redirect_URL_description: URL to be redirected after success message Payment URL with all Payment Methods.
Rest_APIs.Payment_Method_URL_description: Please not User will be directly access to the Payment Gateway instead of Safqa payment landing page

Shipping_API.title: What is Shipping API :
Shipping_API.body1: Shipping service, is an added value service that allows you simply to sell and ship your product through Safqa platform with one payment for your customer. You just need to share your products information to our API with the exact dimensions and weight, then we take care of the rest.
Shipping_API.body2: You can create your shipping invoice to your customer directly without having your products predefined Safqa account. Currently we support both DHL and Aramex
Shipping_API.body3: To use this feature, you have to get your account approved for it, please contact your account manager for more details about this feature
Shipping_API.Prerequisites_body1: Having an API user created and activated
Shipping_API.Prerequisites_body2: Having the shipping feature enabled and activated
Shipping_API.body4: From Safqa portal, the main account login should setup the needed
Shipping_API.list1_body1: POST /Token API to authorize the API user ,this API take username and password and return Token.
Shipping_API.list1_body2: Note: This token will be used in all the next steps to authorize the requests. Add this header to all the requests : 'Authorization': 'Bearer token'
Shipping_API.list2_body: Note: Add this header to the request: 'Authorization': 'Bearer token' from step 1 after calling the API you will get an array of all countries available for shipping.
Shipping_API.list3_body2: Country Code : Please take the code from step 2 response.
Shipping_API.list3_body3: Note: Add this header to the request: 'Authorization': 'Bearer token from step 1 after calling the API you will get an array of all Cities for the selected country available for shipping.
Shipping_API.list4: Call Post ApiShipping/CalculateShippingCharge API with ShippingChargeModel.
Shipping_API.list4_body: Note: Add this header to the request: 'Authorization': 'Bearer token from step 1 after calling the API you will get the shipping charge and the currency type.
Shipping_API.list5: Call Post ApiShipping/CreateShippingInvoiceAPI API with ShippingInvoiceModel.
Shipping_API.list5_body: Note: Add this header to the request: 'Authorization': 'Bearer token from step 1 after calling the API you will get RedirectUrl and available payment methods URLs.
Shipping_API.list6: Use the RedirectURL from step 5 to do the payment
Shipping_API.list7: Once the payment is done successfully, you will be able to download DHL/Aramex AWBl as PDF in the download section of the receipt
Shipping_API.list8_body1: Note: Add this header to the request: 'Authorization': 'Bearer token from step 1 after calling the API you will get list of orders in the given order status & shipping method.
Shipping_API.list9: We have to change the order shipping status to “Prepared” to initiate shipping
Shipping_API.list9_body1: Call Post ApiShipping/UpdateShippingStatus API with Token and ShippingStatusModel
Shipping_API.list9_body2: Note: Add this header to the request: 'Authorization': 'Bearer Token' from step 1 after calling the API you will get the details about updated orders number with status.
Shipping_API.list9_body12: Here you can’t change status to RequestPickup in this API call. If you want to change RequestPickup please follow the step 10
Shipping_API.list10_body1: Note: Add this header to the request: 'Authorization': 'Bearer Token' from step 1, after calling the API you will get the details about updated orders number with status. Now it's ready for order status changing.
Shipping_API.list11: Next use the step 9 to change other status like “Picked/ Delivered”.

Direct_Payment_API.title: What is Direct Payment :
Direct_Payment_API.body1: Allows you simply to process the full payment and result within your application or website through our APIs. By passing the needed parameters, we simply take care of executing the transaction and authorize it with the issuer bank through the gateway and return you the result to be displayed within your application. Rest back and relax, all data communicated with Safqa are encrypted!
Direct_Payment_API.body2: Please note that this feature requires pre-approval for your account with Safqa,
Direct_Payment_API.body3: please contact the account manager for more details about this
Direct_Payment_API.body5: To use Direct Payment API, you have to create API user account or use your existing on.
Direct_Payment_API.body6: Note: Safqa API user must be activated and Direct Payment enabled for the account
Direct_Payment_API.body8: Steps to use Direct Payment API:
Direct_Payment_API.list1: Call /Token API to authorize the API user ,this API take username and password and return Token. This token will be used in all next step to authorize the requests.
Direct_Payment_API.list2: Call Post ApiInvoices/CreateInvoiceIso API with Token and Invoice model.
Direct_Payment_API.Note_text: Add this header to the request: 'Authorization': 'Bearer token' from step 1
Direct_Payment_API.body9: After calling the API you will get an array of all payment methods activated for you. One of them will be visa /master with direct payment API URL.
Direct_Payment_API.body11: Take the payment URL from this payment method for the next step
Direct_Payment_API.list3: Using PaymentMethodUrl that we got it from step2 Create a Post request.
Direct_Payment_API.body13: Add this header to the request: 'Authorization': 'Bearer token from step 1'
Direct_Payment_API.body14: Put the card info parameter you collect from the user on the body and call the request

Transaction_Create_API_Invoices.Transaction_Create_API_Invoices: Transaction Result - Create Rest API Invoices
Transaction_Create_API_Invoices.title: Transaction Result - Create Rest API Invoices
Transaction_Create_API_Invoices.Payment_ID_description: - ID generated after the customer making the payment.
Transaction_Create_API_Invoices.Note1: Please note merchant should copy the Payment ID from the redirected URL and paste it in ApiInvoices/Transactions “id” field and get the Transaction Response.
Transaction_Create_API_Invoices.Invoice_Id_description: - System generated id after making the payment.
Transaction_Create_API_Invoices.Invoice_Reference_description: - System generated reference id after making the payment.
Transaction_Create_API_Invoices.Payment_Gateway_description: - Payment Gateway used by the customer to make the payment.
Transaction_Create_API_Invoices.Reference_Id_description: - ID generated after the customer making the payment.
Transaction_Create_API_Invoices.Transaction_Status_description: - Please note each Transaction Status are described in a value
Transaction_Create_API_Invoices.Paid_Currency_description: - Currency is used to make invoice payment.
Transaction_Create_API_Invoices.Customer_Service_Charge_description: - Any service charge applied to the customer.
Transaction_Create_API_Invoices.Note2: NOTE: Enter the Payment ID in ApiInvoices/ Transactions and get the Transaction Response.

Create_Rest_Invoices_SMS_Email_Request.Invoice_Value_description: Product Unit Price * Quantity of Products. - Please note merchant should manually calculate and enter the subtotal
Create_Rest_Invoices_SMS_Email_Request.Customer_Id_description: Customer Id. - Generated by Safqa system.
Create_Rest_Invoices_SMS_Email_Request.Country_Code_Id_description: County with Phone Code. (Required) - Please note user should enter value of each Country Code. Each Country Codes differentiated by a Value.
Create_Rest_Invoices_SMS_Email_Request.Display_Currency_Id_description: Display Currency Id in Invoice. (Required) - Please note user should enter value of each Currency Id. Each Currency Id’s differentiated by a value.
Create_Rest_Invoices_SMS_Email_Request.Send_Invoice_Option_description: - Please note user should enter value of each option. Each sending options(SMS, Email and Link) differentiated by a value.
Create_Rest_Invoices_SMS_Email_Request.Send_Invoice_Option_1: Generate Invoice and Send link by SMS to the customer's phone.
Create_Rest_Invoices_SMS_Email_Request.Send_Invoice_Option_2: Generate Invoice and Send link by Email to the customer's email.
Create_Rest_Invoices_SMS_Email_Request.Send_Invoice_Option_3: Generate Invoice and Send link by both SMS & Email.
Create_Rest_Invoices_SMS_Email_Request.Product_Id_description: Product Id. (Optional) - Vendor can enter the Product Id, once it is created through Safqa system.
Create_Rest_Invoices_SMS_Email_Request.Language_description: Invoice Language. (Required) - Please note user should enter value of each Language. Each Language options(Arabic or English) differentiated by a value.
Create_Rest_Invoices_SMS_Email_Request.list1: Generate Invoice and Send link by SMS to the customer's phone.
Create_Rest_Invoices_SMS_Email_Request.list2: Generate Invoice and Send link by Email to the customer's email.
Create_Rest_Invoices_SMS_Email_Request.list3: Generate Invoice and Send link by both SMS & Email.
Create_Rest_Invoices_SMS_Email_Request.Redirect_URL_description: URL to be redirected after success message 'Payment URL'.
Create_Rest_Invoices_SMS_Email_Request.note: NOTE: After creating the Invoices, an auto-generated message with invoice link send through the “Send Invoice Options”.

Display_Currencies_Iso_Alpha_with_values.Display_Currencies_Iso_Alpha_with_values: Display Currencies Iso Alpha with values

iOS_Specific.body1: One of the changes in iOS9 is a default setting that requires apps to make network connections only over SSL. This is known as App Transport Security.
iOS_Specific.body2: MFSDK is facilitating the transition to support this change for each of our demand partners in order to ensure they are compliant.
iOS_Specific.body3: In the meantime, developers who want to release apps that support iOS9, will need to disable ATS in order to ensure MFSDK continues to work as expected, and in iOS10 and later only disable ATS for Media and Web content. To do so, developers should add the following to their plist

Usage_Android_SDK.list1: In Android Studio, create a new project or open up an existing project that you want to use the Android archive file library.
Usage_Android_SDK.list2: In the Project view, expand the libs node of the app.
Usage_Android_SDK.list3: Using the Mac Finder or Windows Explorer, select and copy the Android archive file (*.aar) e.g. mfsdk.aar.
Usage_Android_SDK.list4: Paste the aar file into the libs node in Android Studio.
Usage_Android_SDK.list5: Add the following dependencies in the app gradle file.
